items.title: How A.I. Is Helping Architects Change Workplace Design
items.abstract: With more hybrid workers and new office needs, firms like Zaha Hadid Architects are turning to artificial intelligence for solutions.

items.title: Inside the Barbecue City That Is China’s Hottest Tourist Destination
items.abstract: Zibo has become a social media star for its distinctive barbecue style. Now the city is overrun with visitors.

items.title: Why China Doesn’t Have a Property Tax
items.abstract: Local governments are sinking further into debt, but after years of talk, officials have yet to introduce a real estate tax.

items.title: Stalled Sister City Plan Reveals New German Wariness of China
items.abstract: The German port of Kiel and the Chinese port of Qingdao have a lot of things in common. Unfortunately, submarines are among them.

items.title: ‘Rip and Replace’: The Tech Cold War Is Upending Wireless Carriers
items.abstract: As China and the United States jockey for tech primacy, wireless carriers in dozens of states are tearing out Chinese equipment. That has turned into a costly, difficult process.
